column.p: We generally recommend the use of the mailing list maltcms-user for novice users of Maltcms, ChromA and ChromAUI. This is the place to get in contact with the developers quickly and ask questions on just about everything. You can subscribe to the mailing list here or post a message anonymously, which will then be published at the list moderator's discretion. If you discover bugs and are not sure on how to report them, we would also recommend to post your findings on the list, so that we can create a bug tracker item for you.

If you happen to stumble across bugs in Maltcms or any associated application, we would appreciate your feedback. We provide a publicly accessible issue tracker, which does not require you to have an account at sourceforge. However, in order to be able to contact you, we recommend to register an account with sourceforge, or register on the mailing list, where you can also submit a bug report directly. These will then be transferred to our Trac instance issue tracking system.

Software may contain bugs, which are typically hard to spot by the persons writing the software. Although we test Maltcms regularly, it may fail for certain operations, file types or the like. We thus provide means to get help fast from the people developing Maltcms. For advanced users and developers, the first place to turn to is the Trac instance on sourceforge, which allows you to view existing tickets , e.g. reports of known bugs, requests for enhancement and so on. However, in order to be able to create new tickets, you will need to get an account with sourceforge in order to avoid spam.
